website_summaries.verdict: A durable, portable-sized kamado grill that offers features similar to full-sized models, but be sure to check for issues when it's delivered.
pros: With its smaller size, the Akorn Jr. is perfect to take along for picnics, tailgating, and camping
Features a sturdy build with side handles and ash pan that's easy to remove and clean
cons: Has limited cooking space, but you probably won't mind if you need a portable model
A few quality control issues, including missing pieces and surface scratches

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful grill. I am able to reach over 700 ...
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful grill. I am able to reach over 700 degrees with only about 12 coals. It's insane how quickly it can cook. I was able to cook a thin cut steak in three minutes, about a minute and a half on each side. It's awesome. The grill surface is a bit small at about 14 inches of usable diameter. But it's awesome for what it is. It's portable enough to carry around a deck with one person. One word of warning, buy a grill cover, the lower portion of the grill retains water even when closed while in the rain. Cover it to protect it.
customer_reviews.author: Virgil Allen Moore

customer_reviews.title: Missing 2 screws and no charcoal grate! Did a ...
customer_reviews.text: Missing 2 screws and no charcoal grate! Did a warranty claim, haven't heard a peep. Will modify my review when customer service contacts me.
customer_reviews.author: donna t.

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts just like the year old reviews
customer_reviews.text: Think they would have figured this out by now and made the corrections. Not a single fastener (bolt) in the package. Also missing ash pan. Called and was told they would try to get replacements out in 7-10 days. Can’t comment on anything else at this point.
customer_reviews.author: Greg S.

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Cooker - Worth the Money
customer_reviews.text: It's been over 18 years since I smoked meat, but the price on this was marked down and I decided to give it a try. I got the pizza stone as well to cook with indirect heat, plus the stone helps stabilize the temperature. This little cooker worked great! I smoked a pork butt for 5 hours and it turned out very good. Although the temperature fluctuated a little due to its size (that's expected), it was still very controllable. It's very efficient too, because it didn't use as much lump charcoal as I thought it would. I like it because it's easy to pack up and take somewhere. Cleanup was easy. Very good purchase, and I'd do it again.
customer_reviews.author: WW

customer_reviews.title: Rusted rightaway even after cleaning/seasoning. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY.
customer_reviews.text: I will not recommend at all. Bought last Sept 2018 and not even a year and the grill grate is RUSTED. I used it only once and afterwards, I did seasoned it again and put it away and when I opened it to use again, the grate is well rusted. I knew how to season cast iron grate but this one is just not so worth it and you can only by the grate from Akorn and its $20 which is pricey. I wish I can get my money back and return this useless product. DO NOT WASTE your money.
customer_reviews.author: Marya

customer_reviews.title: Best grill I have ever bought
customer_reviews.text: Best grill I have ever bought. I have this one and the bigger version. I have never been a grill master, but after getting this grill and watching a few videos on how to use it everyone loves my cooking now. We take the small one camping with us. I have cooked pizza, Boston butt, steak, hamburgers, hotdogs, chicken,corn, cabbage , squash , pineapple , etc.. with no complaints. I only cook with lump charcoal and Webber fire starter cubes. NO LIGHTER FLUID
customer_reviews.author: Msward

customer_reviews.title: Product Review
customer_reviews.text: I own a Green Egg and wanted to give this little guy a try. Side by side cooking you cannot tell the difference Taste wise . Charcoal test. Did BBq Ribs, and Hamburgers. Smoking consistance temp, hovers around 300s. Brisket came out perfect cooked smoked for 8 hours. Temperature is not hard to control. Does want to Climb to 550 to 600. With Charcoal I normally use 50/50. Wood chips, and charcoal. Putting together was very easy. I Love the Acorn price is just right easy on the Charcoal consumption. Doesn't require nearly as much as other similar sizes. This one is the Jr 14 inch. This is my second one , first one lasted a few years.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Rusted Out and Became Worthless
customer_reviews.text: After a few months of use, the grate rusted badly. I tried every "solution" I could find online - from baking soda to hydrogen peroxide. I scraped, scrubbed, wire brushed...everything (?) I could think of, but the cooking surface was just so rusty that I couldn't cook anything! Eventually, I resorted to tapping the grate with a heavy tool to loosen rust and boom - bye bye grate...it busted right into pieces! :( Soooooo disappointed in myself that I didn't just get a propane grill with a better cooking surface. Wasted money? Akorn Jr. experts please tell me where I've gone wrong!
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Manufacturing Woes
customer_reviews.text: This grill arrived with 3 manufacturing defects I noticed during assembly: the screw holes in one of legs were drilled wrong and the screws just spin instead of tightening, there were chips/scratches in the top of the body of the grill through the powder coat that will eventually rust, there was a big dent/scratch in the inside of the body that will rust and effect the insulation of the body.
customer_reviews.author: Jared James

customer_reviews.title: Akorn jr CharGriller
customer_reviews.text: I bought this based on the reviews. Anticipated some challenges in assembling. My 12-year-old did most of the work, took him barely an hour and it was put together. The instructions are easy, the screw holes may feel like they are mis-drilled, but after a little jiggling and they do line up. Everything was included in the box. No damage in shipping! I'm switching from a gas grill. This is a nice size grill, fits two trips tips, 6-7 chicken thighs. For the price, it is an excellent value!!! Update: grilling in it for the first time was a pleasant surprise! Chicken and beef cooked evenly, without burning. Clean up was easy!
customer_reviews.author: Ildi J. Dihen

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Grill
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty and was easy assembly. This grill is perfect for tailing gating and home use. I had It assembled in 20 mins. We placed ours on our deck that sits on a canal that gets a good amount of wind. The grill is very heavy but for security and safety we drilled a hole in each leg and drilled a long screw into the deck itself. It’s awesome. My husband is a pro chef and loved cooking on it. We bought the cover available on Amazon although I’m sure it will weather well without. Quaility and appearance is spot on. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. I wanted a barbecue grill but don't have need for something large. This is perfect for a couple of people that don't grill a lot or need to make a lot. I've only used it to do some rib eye's so far but it worked great. I need to figure out how to build something for it to stand on as it does sit quite low. Buying a stand is out of the question as they are insanely overpriced. I wish they would provide some option to extend the legs so that it stood taller.
customer_reviews.author: stafford

customer_reviews.title: Retarded handle design. Totally deserves 1 star just for this.
customer_reviews.text: I am half-way done setting it up. Spent just 30 minutes on the first half. But an hour just on one part: the handle. I am taking a break and giving this one star solely for how retarded the handle was designed. The handle won't give you straight access to screw in the nuts after you put in one of the two nuts on each side of the handle. I am just tired. This is stupid. Please fire the engineer who did this. I don't care if the grill turns out to be good. This is extremely poor design and no one should be forced to spend an hour trying and failing to get four nuts and a handle attached.
customer_reviews.author: Garlond

customer_reviews.title: Awesome purchase!
customer_reviews.text: My Akorn Jr arrived today. Unboxing and assembly were very easy. Definitely use a hand screw driver, as others have suggested, so nothing get over tightened. Didn’t take long to bring it up to temp. I used about 15 briquettes and about a forearm piece of oak. Kept it between 400-500 for a few hours for initial burn off and seasoning. We grilled a few hotdogs for dinner and they were great, about 10 min for them and the temp was 400. Can’t wait to smoke/slow cook some meat and grill some good steaks on it. I am building a table to put it in like another reviewer did.
customer_reviews.author: darksideemt

customer_reviews.title: It works just as great as the full size version
customer_reviews.text: I have the full size version of this grill and bought this one to use with my RV. It works just as great as the full size version. It's lighter than the traditional "Ceramic" grill and seems more durable. These hold heat well and heat evenly. I f you want a great, space saving and portable solution to your grilling needs, you won't go wrong with the Acorn Jr.
customer_reviews.author: Radmann07

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: This is sooo perfect. It works so well and is easy. I have it on my apartment balcony and I can take tailgating or anywhere. I've smoked a huge port shoulder easily, grilled burgers, veggies, brats kaboobs, etc on it it so far. I recommend baking the cast iron grill inside the oven at least at 450 degrees, coat it with cooking oil and bake it some more and then let it cook down to season and seal it. The oil will smoke inside the oven fyi, but that is normal. Don't wash it with water after every use, just wipe it down.
customer_reviews.author: KattaK

customer_reviews.title: There's no flavor quite like something that's char-grilled
customer_reviews.text: I can't begin to say enough awesome things about this char-griller! I've made the most delicious steaks, chicken wings, and various grilled vegetables on this thing that made me look like a super hero when we sit down to eat. We live on a 3rd floor apartment where a small outside balcony walkway sits outside our front door. The grill is small enough to safely cook outside our front door. Assembly was easy and it comes with a basic instruction book for what temperatures and times you should use for cooking various meats and how to achieve those temperatures with the grill's ventilation options. I love this grill!
customer_reviews.author: Peter Tracy

customer_reviews.title: Love my red egg!
customer_reviews.text: I needed a small grill cooking for two! So after tons of research I decide on a Kamado style grill. I could in no way afford a full sized 1000$ plus grill. So this was the best compromise. Affordable but made well by a company I was familiar with and trusted. This is a heavy well made grill fires up quickly and maintains an even heat. The built in temperature probe is very helpful. I don’t like how low to the ground it is but I hope to get my son to build me a stand for it soon. If your on the fence buy it it’s a great product!
customer_reviews.author: Mommasuzie

customer_reviews.title: So easy to control the temperature
customer_reviews.text: We have used this every night for the past week. Steaks, hamburgers, veggies, prawns, fruit and garlic kabobs. This little BBQ is absolutely wonderful and cleanup is a breeze. I seasoned it according to the instructions. Flavor is fabulous. We can't say enough good about this little gem. I love that I can have two steaks and a steamer basket with veggies on it at the same time. We had been using a Cobb after downsizing but it was just too small. This BBQ is perfect and the price cannot be beat for the price
customer_reviews.author: Debra L. Holmberg

customer_reviews.title: Decided to give it five even though it's not quite what I wanted.
customer_reviews.text: GOOD steaks and corn and potatoes come out of it. It is not entirely as good as my old kamado, which was huge and imported and ceramic and turned meat red and omg tender, but it is better than the normal barbecue, and far more economical. I am enjoying its use and about to have some gorgeous prime rib steak now. (Found on sale omg...less than $6 a pound which has nothing to do with the rating well other than that it came out like butter! Three quarter inch thick butter...)
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Kramer

customer_reviews.title: With Amazon Prime I had my perfect little grill in 2 days!!
customer_reviews.text: I'm impressed with the high quality of this grill.it is well made and assembly was easy. Loved the included grill grate tool. Seared perfectly, my steaks were juicy and delicious. It kept and maintained its temperature. It did lose its pretty shiny coat but it's a grill and was expected. I do wish the legs were adjustable because It sits low to the ground. I am going to look or build a stand for it. All in all I'm very happy with my purchase and look forward to many years of grilling on my Akorn Jr.
customer_reviews.author: Francesca Judd

customer_reviews.title: Just Perfect in Size, Design and Quality
customer_reviews.text: Size and function and build quality make this a perfect grill. This couldn't be better. Assembly was well designed and the unit is super cute. I never expected how tightly it seals all over. In terms of function, my gun thermometer reports that even when it's over 500 degrees inside, the outside surface is well under 200 degrees. I have this parked on a wooden balcony and feel confident it doesn't pose a fire hazard. I used some hardwood 1x3's inserted in the tripod leg tubes to elevate this closer to eye level. Close all vents and the charcoal goes out and can be reused. Cast iron grill cleans very easily when cold. Couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: StudioWalker

customer_reviews.title: Dissapointing!
customer_reviews.text: Great quality, convienient! Update, have only had less than 3 months and 2 pieces broke off, grill and heat vent!!! Cant believe it, we cannot control the heat now. Super dissapointing.
customer_reviews.author: Sphynxy

customer_reviews.title: Love this little smoker
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little smoker. Excellent temperature control. Need to buy heat deflector separately (this should be included but it's not). Also, probably worth it to double-check the price against local big-box stores. This is a relatively heavy grill, especially for the size, and would be difficult to return via Amazon. A little disappointed with the alignment of the lid after assembly. There are no gaps (critical for a grill) but it is a little off and shouldn't be. Also, the grill is smaller, enough for 2 - 4 servings but not more (1 spatch-cocked chicken, 4 - 5 fish fillets, 1 pork shoulder). Be sure it's big enough for your needs.
customer_reviews.author: cas

customer_reviews.title: Works great to roast, grill, as a slow cooker and smoker
customer_reviews.text: It is an awesome little grill that works very well, still, it is priced at a fraction of the equivalent from better-known brands. In minutes ( literally ), I have grilled 4 ribeyes, 15 chicken legs & 5 sausages, 2 full racks of pork ribs, a full Boston butt pork roast, smoked 20 large shrimps and 5 chicken legs ... Each time the result was outstanding, crispy outside and moist inside. It is a no brainer: I highly recommend this BBQ. I do not know how long it will last, but if it rusts out, we love it so much already that I will likely get another one asap.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent Lasfargues

customer_reviews.title: Poor design and build quality.
customer_reviews.text: This grill is disappointing. Fit and finish is very poor. Latches don’t close and the bolts for assembly are not well made and cam out easily. In addition, it is quite a challenge to assemble. Some of the bolts go in inaccessible areas so you need special screwdrivers/wrenches to assemble it. Took me over an hour to build due to making numerous trips to the basement for different tools to assemble it.
customer_reviews.author: R. Myers

customer_reviews.title: Blown away by this little guy! Like BGE!!
customer_reviews.text: Blown away by this little guy, bought for camping but haven’t been camping in a while so I’ve been using at home. I usually cook on a Large Green Egg, now when I’m just cooking for 2 or 3 I use this. Heats up quickly, easy to transport, great flavor with lump charcoal. Great features like locking lid, center of grill is removable so you can add charcoal, removable, detachable bottom for ash dumping. It will get hot quickly so you have to keep an eye on it so you don’t melt it like that other guy, in the reviews 🙄. (There’s always that one bad review) So far so good, it’s awesome.
customer_reviews.author: jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I have owned a few ceramic smokers , the egg, the original Bubba keg and a generic one. I wanted something smaller and I love the style. Assembly was really easy very good instructions. The fire bowl doesn’t sit firmly until you add the grills on top then it still moves a bit. The temperature control was so so the bottom vent is very cheap with lots of gaps. I grilled a steak the first night and it was excellent. I am smoking a pork butt today we will see how it goes.
customer_reviews.author: lisa doyle

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly big enough for the whole family
customer_reviews.text: Works better than advertised. Assembly has a tricky part at the end. You need a Phillips tip and 1/4" wrench to put on the handle. No big deal. Still learning it but have had excellent results everytime. Outside stays cool so you can move it while lit. Uses very little charcoal. Less than half of what is lit becomes ash. When you snuff it over half the coals are ready to light again. This means you put in very little each time. The grill size is enough to cook for more than 4 people. 6 hamburger pattys for instance fit fine. I love this grill.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Marcikese

customer_reviews.title: Super griller/cooker/smoker!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Still experimenting with my Akorn but I really think it's the cat's meow! I've never been a grill master because my wife has been doing that for years and personally I've never been one to sit out with the pit and inhale smoke all day. This akorn has done justice to a turkey and a brisket for me and it has been a snap. Lot's of videos on you tube on how to set it up and how to cook with it! Amazing how little charcoal this thing uses!! Why get a large expensive Kamoto when this inexpensive little gem does it just as well!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: G. Luker

customer_reviews.title: Great Value Little Grill
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Perfect size for 2 or 3 people. It’s a little on the cheap side in terms of materials used, but it works great and wasn’t expensive either. I added leg extensions to it so I could cook standing up. Makes a big difference.
customer_reviews.author: !m!  !m!

customer_reviews.title: Handle assembly not for the faint of heart!
customer_reviews.text: We haven’t use this little grill yet but we spent the better part of the morning attempting to assemble it. The front handle is in desperate need of re-design! I can’t believe how many reviews mentioned the difficulty of getting the handle onto the grill. The holes were slightly misaligned, But that was overcome by really drilling the holes in the handle holders. The angle of the handle holders, the angle of the bolt entry and the hole misalignment made for a trying hour. We will write another review after using this grill. Surprisingly heavy and attractive!
customer_reviews.author: Steven Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Portable and efficient little grill/smoker combo
customer_reviews.text: Neat little smoker and grill combo, super portable and very efficient. Ive grilled steaks, chicken, seafood and smoked pork butts, brisket, full chickens. I've taken it tailgating and on camping trips and have no problem muscling it in and out of the truck with the supplied handles. Get a drip tray or something to defray the smoke off to the sides. Also invest in a decent cover from day one. Mine went a week or two without use after a good rain and I found the ash pan was full of water that leaked through the vent, that is my only knock on this unit. Bought a cover the next day but have a little rust from this mistake!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a very effective BBQ
customer_reviews.text: OK--first the negative--there were like 30-40 parts. We hired a guy to put together some deck boxes so I just had him assemble it for me. It works extremely well. I have not begun to use it according to all of it's potential. Supposedly we can do pizza outdoors on it. I've done many kinds of meat, and mushrooms. I love it It functions very well as a smoker. And when you shut it down after use, you can save your coals for the next time you fire it up! I recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Tom Salter

customer_reviews.title: best charcoal cooker I've used!!
customer_reviews.text: Now my favorite outside charcoal cooker. very efficient with hardwood charcoal............don't use briquettes as they leave a lot of residue and ruin the flavor of what you cook. I've grilled many meats, bake breads, even made acceptable yorkshire pudding and am impressed with this unit especially at the low price. Takes a bit of getting used to, but it's not rocket science. thermometer is the only weak point, but easily compensates once you get familiar with it. Beets the hell out of those LPG throw away units that are so popular now.
customer_reviews.author: smokey

customer_reviews.title: damage inside grill
customer_reviews.text: I have never had a problem with returned items but this was in like new condition but it has damage to the porcelain on the interior of the grill, did not notice until I had put it together should inspect all parts before assembly. Update I let the company Chargrill know about the problem I had and they were amazing sent a new bottom half of grill and made sure I was a satisfied customer.
customer_reviews.author: brenda l. reiter

customer_reviews.title: Don't let the size scare you ... great little smoker.
customer_reviews.text: Great little smoker. This is a perfect size, it gets bonus points for being small enough to bring along on boating/camping weekends. Arrived quickly, very well packaged and easy to assemble (nice to see a manufacturer use the same size bolts rather than having 4 or 5 types of hardware). As many reviewers noted, the thermometer can be a bit erratic and using separate probes for grill temp and meat is worth doing.
customer_reviews.author: Robo

customer_reviews.title: Great little grill
customer_reviews.text: Love this grill. It's a perfect size for my husband and myself. I especially like the cast iron grate. It's easy to clean and does a great job with burgers, steak, chicken and whatever else you can think of. At the end of grilling I close the vents and the fire goes out. Next time I grill, I still have a lot of unburned charcoal so I just need to throw a handful of new briquettes to start her up. I am using less than half of my normal charcoal consumption.
customer_reviews.author: Fran Decker

customer_reviews.title: Check your parts! I'm talking to the people who packaged this!
customer_reviews.text: So far I am loving this grill. I decided to go back to charcoal grilling after using propane for decades, and this portable (less than 40 pounds I think) grill lets me take the grill with me. Very easy to clean, holds the heat like a champ and has a large enough cooking surface. The only minor issue was that the parts were lacking a screw for the top vent, but it is secure enough with just the 2 screws. Best options to buy with this are 1) heat resistant gloves, a must. 2) Charcoal Chimney starter - 15 minutes and you're in business 3) Cover - keeps it nice looking 4) BBQ Tongs- essential 5) BBQ spatula - essential
customer_reviews.author: Richard Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.text: I've retired my gas grill and I use this for all of my grilling and smoking. I've made several pork shoulders, a few racks of ribs, a pizza, as well as steaks and burgers. This little guy worked perfectly, even when it's below freezing outside. There is a small learning curve to controlling the temp, but once you figure it out you no longer need to hover over it fiddling the dampers. I recommend getting a dual probe Bluetooth temp sensor, one for the ambient temp and one for the meat.
customer_reviews.author: J. Atkinson

customer_reviews.title: I grill all winter in Minnesota. This grill is top of the line to me (Small size).
customer_reviews.text: I grill all winter in Minnesota. I bought this as a starter insulated grill thinking I would buy a bigger one if I liked it. Bigger for what? I can control the temperature so well with this grill that I can fill it with enough food to feed 6 people, and serve perfectly cooked smokey flavored meat, no flair up’s no chard meat and the outside of the grill is always cool to the touch so I can move it back to the party when the food is done.
customer_reviews.author: Troy Stanton

customer_reviews.title: VERY IMPRESSED!
customer_reviews.text: Received on Tuesday, 8/20. Put together and grilled a whole chicken next day. Substantial, well made grill. Easy to assemble except for handles. Did a fantastic job on chicken. The chicken didn't stick. It was moist and flavorful. Follow directions and see the dozens of helpful youtube videos. Only problem....I didn't use enough charcoal and had to add more. Was not difficult to control the temperature as long as you pay attention. So glad I bought this model.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Ratzke

customer_reviews.title: great quality
customer_reviews.text: i have NEVER given 5 stars to anything but this item is absolutely amazing Easy to put together and the best quality material ever. I have a large Green egg and wanted this for just the two of us, its perfect
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Stanger

customer_reviews.title: Very nice grill... Versatile
customer_reviews.text: My first time using a kamado grill and love it. I particularly like this one because it only partial ceramic and not as subjected to cracks and breaks as the more expensive ones. The learning curve is short, it is user-friendly, and creates a nice cooking surface. A grilled and smoked on this unit with success. I’m happy with it and can recommend it to others.
customer_reviews.author: Gordon A. Migliore

customer_reviews.title: OUTSTANDING customer service from the company.
customer_reviews.text: Slowly but surely I'm learning to use it. :) Very pleased with the results and flavor is SO superior to gas. When I first received it the fire bowl didn't seem to fit correctly. I registered the grill at their website and called Customer Service. A very nice lady told me to take a short video showing the issue and email to her. Less than 24 hours later I got a reply telling me in fact the engineer said it was not correct and two days later I had a new fire bowl that fits perfectly. Very impressive service.
customer_reviews.author: LKsquirrel13

customer_reviews.title: Buy it! You won’t be disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Love this little thing! Holds heat like a boss. Don’t let the heat get away from you though! Also the handle could’ve been a little easier to put on, sheesh. Well worth the money. I’m making some leg extensions with PVC that I saw on Pinterest.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Janaski

customer_reviews.title: Best BBQ we've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic BBQ smoker - high quality and easy to assemble. Started the 1st fire with 2 handfuls of lump charcoal burned 700F for an hour and closed the dampers next day had 1/2 the charcoal we started with! Love the way you empty ashes - a removable bottom section clean and fast way to dump the ashes. Highly recommend for 2 people or for tailgating.
customer_reviews.author: Babs F

customer_reviews.title: Grill
customer_reviews.text: The best grill I've used. Holds the heat like a champ. Controlling the heat with the airflow dampers is super easy. The quality is over the top. One can tell Char-Grill has done a great job. There isn't anything about this grill that feels flimsy or looks cheap. It's the perfect size for two or three people. The price is very reasonable. I read some reviews complaining about the screw holes not being properly aligned. I've assembled 2 of these in the last week with no issues. My MIL saw ours and really loved it, so I got her one for her birthday. Very pleased with this grill
customer_reviews.author: Wayne

customer_reviews.title: a true cookin mohican
customer_reviews.text: hello, I bought this because it was pretty cheap. ive used it to cook a new York strip steak which turned out really good.used it today may 27 for some boneless pork country style ribs and a link of heb sausage and it was the best in a long time. this little cooker along with mesquite lump charcoal did the trick. I cooked it for a hour and a half, the temp held right at 250 260 it carmelized the sweet baby rays sauce to perfection, not a complaint one on this grill. great for 2 people buy it and enjoy it.
customer_reviews.author: joe simms

customer_reviews.title: Awesome grill
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble and use. You can slow cook and smoke in it, and still get way hot enough to sear those rib steaks. The dampers control the temp but it's a little tough to get it just right. When your finished cooking just close the dampers and it kills the fire and the grill cools in about 1-2 hours depending on outside temps.
customer_reviews.author: Tool Man

customer_reviews.title: What a bargain!
customer_reviews.text: Can’t say enough good things about this little guy. For the price of a Weber kettle grill, you can have a kamado smoker. It’s 90% of a Green Egg for 30% of the price. No, it’s not ceramic, but it still gets the job done. Considering the price I was shocked at how good the build is. That said, you will need to budget for the ceramic heat plate if you want to do any all-day smoking, and if you plan to keep it outside in the rain, you’ll also need to buy a cover.
customer_reviews.author: Musicfan145

customer_reviews.title: Owned for a few months, would absolutely buy again
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, I love this thing. I’ve been using it a couple times a week for a few months now and it’s one of my all time favorite purchases. It’s super solid and gets as hot as you want. I saw the pictures of the persons grill that melted all the paint off and almost didn’t buy it but now that I own it I’m seriously wondering how they even got that to happen. We have accidentally maxed out the temperature gauge (which you shouldn’t do) and nothing bad happened at all
customer_reviews.author: Caitlin Dietrick

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful but ordered two and both had flaws
customer_reviews.text: Both Acrons had finishes on the inside that was not complete. The powder coat was missing so the foam could be seen. That concerned me that the foam would be an issue and create an issue. Had hoped it would come without flaws. Had to return both grills
customer_reviews.author: pj

customer_reviews.title: Solid grill/ Smoker can’t go wrong with Akorn.
customer_reviews.text: Solid grill/smoker, it works amazing for grilling, the mid to high temperature control is the best. The only issue I encountered was when I was overnight smoking meat the vents would not allow enough air inside causing the coals to go out a few times. I had to keep everything open to solve this unlike the directions.
customer_reviews.author: B. Narinesingh

customer_reviews.title: We use this fantastic grill all the time
customer_reviews.text: This is the best charcoal smoker you can get for the money! I bought my husband and my brother one and both have been great. We use ours weekly, and it’s perfect for our two-person home. We also take it camping and tailgating. We have a big charcoal grill that we haven’t lit up since buying this. We use so much less charcoal and cook food in a quarter of the time it took on the big one. Burgers, steaks, chicken, veggies; they come out perfectly every time now. Anyone who loves to BBQ or is thinking about starting needs this grill.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little smoker.
customer_reviews.text: The only thing negative I can say is the front latch does not line up perfectly and it takes both hands to latch. I haven't done any long smokes yet, but I have no doubt it will work perfectly. I wanted to experiment with cheaper cooks before I possibly screwup something expensive. I still use my Weber Kettle for basic grilling.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Hall

customer_reviews.title: This is a great grill
customer_reviews.text: This grill works extremely well. We have always used a gas grill but the Acorn has made us converts. The taste is so much better then gas plus it was very easy to put together, it took about 30 minutes. It heats up quickly and once you are done grilling just shut both vents and you will still have some lump coal left for the next time.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: Poor handle design
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used the grill yet BUT the handle design is piss poor!!! You can not use a socket , nut drive or even a right angle drill attachment, it didn't help that the right side holes didn't match up, used a box wrench but you can't tighten completely because of the tapered plastic bracket. It took about 10 minutes to put everything else together, 45 minutes on the handle and stopped before I threw the thing thru my screened in porch
customer_reviews.author: Wayne

customer_reviews.title: Great grill for the price!
customer_reviews.text: What a great little grill👍🏻! I’ve grilled burgers and came out great ! I’ve Smoked a prime rib roast, a beer can chicken and 2 beef ribs! All smoked good! It will take some time learning the damper adjustments but that is on me. 👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻
customer_reviews.author: tjt

customer_reviews.title: Great Grill
customer_reviews.text: I have had this grill for a few months now, and it has been amazing! It is great at regulating temperature at 225° for smoking, or over 700° for pizza or steak. I melted the seasoning off the cast iron grate. I think it was almost 1000°. I recommend smashing lump charcoal into smaller pieces for over 500°, and use bigger pieces for longer and lower smoking sessions. I wish I would have bought one of the bigger models. It would be nice to have more cooking surface, or possibly two zone cooking.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Remington

customer_reviews.title: Enjoying Charcoal Again
customer_reviews.text: So far we've enjoyed this mini-egg style grill. It went together without a hitch and although the front latch doesn't quite line up it's only an 8th inch off and still easy to latch shut for a good seal. This type of grill has a learning curve but I haven't ruined any food yet! No issues so far with water in the ash catcher as others have posted but we keep the vents closed, grill is under a "grillzebo".
customer_reviews.author: climb4

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts
customer_reviews.text: I received my JR. Akron Komondor Kooker on June 24th, which I assembled that afternoon. I was excited to start cooking on my new smoker/cooker, but realized the unit came with no grilling grate. I’ve contacted the customer service dept. at Char-Griller and they requested proof of purchase, along with the serial number of the unit , which I do have and included. How do I show a “proof of purchase” when none is provided? I’m a little disappointed that I will not be able to use my new smoker/ grill this weekend. Can you help?
customer_reviews.author: Daryl Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievable for steaks
customer_reviews.text: This is the best grill I’ve used to sear/grill steaks. Easy to use. Only downside is it’s not very large. It’s a squeeze to get 3 healthy Tbones/Porterhouse steaks on it. But I do and they turn out great. I bought the heat deflector for it and tried to smoke some ribs on it but gave up after flare ups and I can only fit a rack and a half on the grate. Knowing what I know now I’d still buy it just for grilling steaks.
customer_reviews.author: M Preston

customer_reviews.title: Excellent !!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This has excessed my needs ! As the pictures show 14 inches is a fair cooking surface. My friend made me a stand to eliminate bending over. Use a ratchet and socket and pre-fit assembly completely together before tightening. 1 picture shows left over charcoal between cooks. Char-Griller Smoking Stone Jr works perfect and placing 12 inch Unicook 12 inches pizza stone on top of it will work great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Color Description is Not Accurate
customer_reviews.text: Overall the grill works great. Very easy to get the inside to 500-600 degrees and the charcoal lasts many cooks. Great for a medium size family. Can do 7 large burgers or 10 brats without space inbetween each. My main complaint is the color is NOT red as described. It is a maroon or dark brick red color. You can look through the reviewer photos and see the difference in the reds. They must have changed the color at some point. Not a huge deal, but also how hard is it to accurately describe the color of your products? Have to knock points off for that.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Great quality!!
customer_reviews.text: When I received this not put together I was a bit worried I wouldn't be able to! But! It was easy! Easy instructions that I barely read ( like most people lol ). And the quality is fantastic! So easy to grill just 1 or 2 burgers. You can put a lot of stuff on this grill, bigger than I expected. And in my opinion, Its just so darn cute. LOL Love this grill!!
customer_reviews.author: Debra

customer_reviews.title: Handle screws dont line up
customer_reviews.text: Overall very easy to assemble but the handle took me the longest. The screws wont line up so I drilled the holes wider. The right handle went in easy after I drilled them out. But the left one I was only able to screw in the lower one. The top thread on the left side is facing up so I wasn't able to screw it in. I didn't have any wiggle room cause the lower screw bottomed out. (as seen in the picture with the arrows). I will contact amazon to see what they say. The handle feels solid though.
customer_reviews.author: Ayala

customer_reviews.title: Great little insulated grill!
customer_reviews.text: Was missing one small bolt from hardware package, which had opened and spilled about. Rectified by 9 cent trip to hardware store. Simple assembly. Great temp control! Uses very small amounts of charcoal, very efficient. Love cooking with this!
customer_reviews.author: Bubba

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for the money
customer_reviews.text: Works great...better than others that cost 4x the price. Assembly was easy, but a few screw heads stripped a bit when using my power driver. Purchased smoker stone from their website that really works well. Highly recommend this smoker for the price.
customer_reviews.author: AJS

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Ive had one of the big akorns and now have a primo and this little will do everything the big ones will just on a smaller scale. Took mine on vacation with me and never ate out. Perfect for camping or when couple for only 2 or 3 folks.
customer_reviews.author: joey

customer_reviews.title: Best smoker ever
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love the Akorn Jr! Out of all my cookers this one is by far my favorite and with only a few cooks I was already wanting the larger akorn. The temperature builds insanely fast, regulates temp perfectly and this cooker conserves so much fuel! Honestly $150 is a steal. The smoking stone is a must as well!
customer_reviews.author: Slingdick

customer_reviews.title: This thing Rocks
customer_reviews.text: Product is well made. Had a weber smokey Joe that Ilked but like this even better. I had it up too 600 degrees made a steak. It was the best steak I have tasted in years.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Small but does the job.
customer_reviews.text: I live alone and wanted to start bbq meals again. I used to cook out all the time. I've been in the market for a grille for a couple of years. I ran across this deal and wow was I surprised at the price! I bought it, assembled it, seasoned it and the real test for me is to smoke a chicken. Best chicken ever! This grill is small and mighty.
customer_reviews.author: Shelley B

customer_reviews.title: Very difficult assembly
customer_reviews.text: Haven't gotten past the assembly yet....the threading for the screw holes is not well aligned. It took am inordinate amount of time to put this thing together. Hoping it does a better job of grilling and doesn't fall apart mid cook cycle. Stay tuned for the next installment.
customer_reviews.author: beth

customer_reviews.title: Very good grill!
customer_reviews.text: A very nice grill. My first Kamado style grill and I am really impressed. This thing can get super hot, ideal for steaks and such. It can also so low and slow. Although I will say it is a bit tricky to keep the temperature low for hours at a time. I’m sure with a few more cooks I’ll get better at it. Still an overall awesome grill that I would recommend at this price range!
customer_reviews.author: Joel Ayala

customer_reviews.title: Good for One or Two
customer_reviews.text: If you are single or double this little grill works like the bigger one. I can smoke a 4 lb pork butt no problem. The included temperature gauge needs prayer. Using a digital gauge will make you happier. Keep it out of the weather because the bottom tends to rust if exposed. Use only the recommended chunk charcoal.
customer_reviews.author: Abernathy

customer_reviews.title: Possibly the best grill pound for pund you can buy
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure why others seem to think the legs for this grill are substandard. Everything about this grill exceeds it's price tag. Is it perfect? For the price I might have to say it is perfect. I don't expect it to last as long as the competing brands at 2 to 3 times the cost, but I cannot find any faults with it. As long as it's taken care of I could see it lasting far longer than my precious grills. I have read the thermometer is inaccurate, but you can replace it if you really need to. You will not regret buying this grill.
customer_reviews.author: tradmax

customer_reviews.title: Best item I’ve ever bought on Amazon.
customer_reviews.text: This is the best thing I have ever bought on Amazon. I love this grill. The quality is so good for its price point. I haven’t stopped grilling since I’ve got it. Use a good lump charcoal and 4 chunks will last you 4 days worth of grilling with almost no ash. I want to collect the other Akorn Char-Griller grills.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality and better than expected
customer_reviews.text: We really like the quality and the product works as advertisied
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 10 minute assembly
customer_reviews.text: I will indeed upgrade to a bigger one, but this lil guy here is just lights out the love of my cooking life! If you're unsure about the "egg" life get it to sample it. Once, you have been hooked go big! UPGRADE!!! Unless you're just cooking for 1-2 then stick with this.
customer_reviews.author: J. McClendon

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE this grill
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this grill! Perfect for two people especially when one of us is a vegan! Easy assembly. Good quality and very efficient to use. If you watch the temps verses charcoal time and amount you'll get a great grill every time and its low sale price makes it a 5 Star buy.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Dalgaard

customer_reviews.title: Efecient and cute, BUY IT!
customer_reviews.text: This is probably our best purchase in the last 10 years, so little charcoal can cook so much, you can use it to cook so many things, like plantains, meats, veggies, it is super easy to start the fire, it is super cute and small and OH GOD! After cooking just throw some sweet potatoes, close it and bon apetit the next day or later!
customer_reviews.author: Claudia Salazar

customer_reviews.title: Great little introductory grill for learning egg style cookers
customer_reviews.text: Nice little item to get you started in egg-style cooking for not a lot of money. Fully $50 cheaper than anywhere around that sells them. Arrived in good shape with all of the parts needed. Just a note...when trying to attach the handle, use a 6-8 inch phillips style screwdriver to attach it....and there is a left and a right side bracket. other than that, its a great little grill that would be perfect for travel, camping as well as cooking for 2 or 3 people.
customer_reviews.author: unklgreg

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Wished we had thought about this small grill before getting the big one that we haven’t even used just for the two of us. My husband loves it. He uses it every weekend. Gives me a break from cooking this summer. 😉 It’s perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Michele L. Rogers

customer_reviews.title: The little grill that could
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic little grill/smoker. Used ours all summer. It’ll get extremely hot if you want but will also stay around 150F for smoking too. Make sure to buy a cover for it, oursheld water in the bottom and rusted, my own fault for leaving it out in the weather.
customer_reviews.author: jordan gelinas

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Patio Grill
customer_reviews.text: I love this little grill! It's perfect for a patio. It's not heavy, but regarding portability, it takes a while to cool down after cooking, so it's not really a tailgate grill in my opinion. Really easy to use, easily holds 6+ chicken breast, great value!
customer_reviews.author: caltex77

customer_reviews.title: We bought this one and we ended getting a bigger one by the same company
customer_reviews.text: Great little grill. we've been able to use the same charcoal up to 4 times. It heats up quick just like it cools down quick. We found one 4 times the size of the Akorn Jr. Its awesome just like its little brother!!
customer_reviews.author: Joe H. Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: I was really impressed with the quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son who likes to smoke meats. It assembled easily in about 20 minutes. The quality of the packaging and the quality of the unit appears to be far better than most Chinese made goods. On a par with the best I've seen. Of course, time will tell. Not sure how it does as far as smoking meats
customer_reviews.author: Old Goof

customer_reviews.title: Great grill in a small package
customer_reviews.text: I’m super happy with my grill so far. I’ve used it three times, and grilled chicken, skirt steak and burgers, and also corn on the cob. Everything so far came out great. It is really easy to start it and get it to heat up, and also relatively easy to control the temperature while cooking. Need to try smoking next! By the way, no discoloration on mine so far.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Love this grill
customer_reviews.text: This grill is amazing! It hold the heat for hours. We have used it with charcoal bricks to cook basic burgers and dogs as well as steaks and chops, same results each time. Easy to control temps with top and bottom vents. Also have smoked ribs and beef in it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It is large enough for a 3 person family and the prices is excellent
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because of the price initially. I know love it for the easy of use and smoke that it produces to flavor the meat I've cooked on it. Burgers and steaks so far. Uses only small amounts of charcoal. All the materials are very high quality
customer_reviews.author: Phil Nelsen

customer_reviews.title: Simply awesome for the money...
customer_reviews.text: I've been grilling and smoking for long time and this is truly one of the best, most cost effective smokers I've ever seen. Some of the bad reviews I've seen are truly comical. If you remotely know what you're doing, great piece of gear.
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Little Grill/Smoker and Fun!
customer_reviews.text: This little grill/smoker is great! It is well built and assembly took me about 20 minutes. Temperature control is very easy and it held 225 to 250 degrees for hours on end for low and slow smokes. The cast iron cooking grate is nice and thick and sturdy. Lots of people say to use lump charcoal and is recommended by the manufacturer, but because this grill can hold temperatures very well and takes a lot less fuel I use Kingsford charcoal with no problems at all. If you need a grill/smoker to cook for 2 to 4 people this is what you need. It is simply the most efficient and easy to use grill/smoker for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little charcoal grill
customer_reviews.text: Great little kamado grill! Perfect for small decks, picnics, car/trailer camping. Very efficient with charcoal & easy to regulate grill temperature once you get used to using it. I like that the outside stays relatively cool even after hours of use. I also have the full size version of this kamado grill, but use the small one when I am grilling smaller amounts of food.
customer_reviews.author: Scott N.

customer_reviews.title: Damaged Goods
customer_reviews.text: This grill is great!!! However, it was slightly damaged and I continued to assemble hoping it wouldn’t interfere with my cooking and the taste of foods. Well, it works but I’m still concerned about the damage. So, I’m thinking of returning hoping to get a non damaged grill.
customer_reviews.author: angela

customer_reviews.title: Great grill / Smoker
customer_reviews.text: I’ve cooked on Weber’s with offset heat to get a smoked “effect “ . This grill has been amazing right out of the box. I’m cooking a 6lb brisket right now and keeping the temp at 225-250 is so easy. I did buy the stone with it. It’s small, but for me and 3 others it’s perfect. This is the grill/smoker I’ve been looking for for years. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Has a short life
customer_reviews.text: Don’t buy. It doesn’t last. Had it under shelter and the bottom ash catcher and temp controller rusted out and fell off. Should have laster longer. Just to look at it, that would be the last thing you would expect to happen!
customer_reviews.author: L. Snider

customer_reviews.title: Easy assembly
customer_reviews.text: I have not yet used the grill but it was very easy to assemble and everything fit tight like it should. It is no to heavy to move around. I will be using it in the next few days and will let you know how it worked
customer_reviews.author: albert

customer_reviews.title: High Value Alternative to More Expensive Grills
customer_reviews.text: Beats the heck out of the four-figure cost of larger such grills. Heavy duty construction. Easy to clean. Reaches temperatures exceeding 600 degrees easily. High value.
customer_reviews.author: SKGIII

customer_reviews.title: Challenge to Assemble
customer_reviews.text: Overall, nice little devise. Assembly was a challenge. The main hinge holes where out of alignment so the lid sat crooked. Had to enlarge the bolt holes to adjust. Handle screws were difficult to install. Had to enlarge those holes as well. Took a long time to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: ronald e.

product_meta.title: Char-Griller E06614 Charcoal Grill
product_meta.description: Color:redThe Char-Griller Acorn Jr. Kamado Kooker portable Charcoal grill features dual dampers, heat Gauge, & Triple wall steel with insulation to deliver a superior grilling experience. The cast iron cooking grates keep flare-ups low & you can grill more with less charcoal. Our easy dump ash pan makes cleans up quick & easy, The hinged lid allows for easy access & keeps the lid in place while you cook. The AKORN Jr. Kamado Kooker offers easy mobility & portability with built in handles & a locking lid. Perfect for tailgating, camping, Park grilling or backyard barbecuing. Primary cooking area: 153 square". Color: red. Triple wall steel, holds heat like ceramic, easy mobility, dual damper
feature_bullets: 153 Square inch primary cooking area with cast iron grates
Kamado style grills promote even heating to enhance flavor
Easy dump ash pan for fast and simple cleanup. Ignition Type-No Ignition System
Top and bottom air dampers for easy and precise temperature control
More durable, affordable, and lighter weight than ceramic grills - great for tailgating, camping or going to the park
Holds heat like the more expensive ceramic grills - grill more with less charcoal
Features dual air-flow dampers, hinged locking lid, heat gauge, and triple wall steel with insulation to deliver a superior grilling experience
Convenient handles for portability and grilling on the go - perfect for camping, tailgating, RV, and more

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars1,399 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
